item.title: US national security adviser says China has biggest program to interfere in election
item.description: China has the largest program among countries seeking to interfere in the US election and has taken the most active role, US national security adviser Robert O Brien said on Friday, although he provided no details.

item.title: Jacob Blake pleads not guilty to charges prior to Kenosha shooting
item.description: Jacob Blake, the 29-year-old Black man whose shooting by a white police officer in Kenosha, Wisconsin, reignited nationwide protests over racism and police brutality, pleaded not guilty on Friday to criminal charges filed prior to the shooting.

item.title: Canada slaps first fines on plane travelers without masks
item.description: Two Canadians have been fined Can$1,000 (US$765) each for refusing to wear masks on passenger flights, marking the first such sanctions against travelers in the country amid the ongoing coronavirus crisis, the transportation ministry announced Friday.

item.title: Benedict XVI becomes oldest pope in history
item.description: At the age of 93 and nearly five months, Benedict XVI officially became the oldest pope in history on Friday, even if the record is complicated by the fact that he stepped down in 2013 and holds the status of "pope emeritus".

item.title: WHO 'will not endorse' vaccine if not safe, effective
item.description: The World Health Organization (WHO) insisted Friday it would never endorse a vaccine that has not proven safe and effective, amid concerns over the rush to develop a jab for coronavirus disease (COVID-19).

item.title: Palace attributes August inflation to gradual reopening of economy
item.description: Malacañang on Friday welcomed the country s inflation recorded for the month of August, which dipped slightly to 2.4% from 2.7% the month before.

item.title: Group urges solon to probe Province of China products
item.description: A think-tank group on Friday urged Pwersa ng Bayaning Atleta (PBA) party-list Representative Jericho Nograles to investigate the Chinese beauty product which listed its Manila address as a “province” of China, saying it already reached Davao City and other parts of the country.

item.title: Man caught on camera stealing plants in Cainta shop
item.description: A man was caught on camera stealing plants in a shop in Cainta, Rizal. According to a report on “Stand for Truth” on Friday, Amor Alcantara was shocked to discover that her plants kept missing one by one.

item.title: PNP reports 39 new COVID-19 cases, total at 4,330
item.description: The Philippine National Police (PNP) on Friday reported 39 new coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) infections among its police officers, bringing the total to 4,330.

item.title: PNP chief Cascolan reassigns 7 senior officials
item.description: The chief of the Philippine National Police (PNP) on Friday has ordered the reassignment of seven senior officials in the agency.

item.title: Ardot Parojinog died of heart attack, tested for COVID-19 -PNP
item.description: Former Ozamiz City councilor Ricardo "Ardot" Parojinog died of a heart attack and probable COVID-19, Police Regional Office 10 chief Brigadier General Rolando Anduyan said.

item.title: Online scammer steals friend s identity
item.description: An online scammer stole her friend s identity to create a fake Facebook account to earn money, Jun Veneracion reported on “24 Oras” on Friday.

item.title: QC COVID-19 cases now at 12,695 with over 9,000 recoveries
item.description: The number of coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) cases validated by the Quezon City Epidemiology and Surveillance Unit (QCPD) rose to 12,695 on Friday with 378 new cases.

item.title: GCash reminds cash aid beneficiaries vs unofficial SMS messages
item.description: Mobile wallet GCash reminded beneficiaries of the government s Social Amelioration Program (SAP) not to entertain messages from random mobile numbers regarding their cash subsidy.

item.title: PDEA seizes P6-M ecstasy tablets in Parañaque
item.description: Operatives of the Philippine Drug Enforcement Agency (PDEA) seized around 4,000 pieces of ecstasy tablets worth P6 million inside from a house in an exclusive subdivision in Parañaque.
